channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Week: The Shutdown Ends at Last
item.description: Plus: Remembering James Watson and his complicated legacy.

item.title: Iowa special education aide fired over Charlie Kirk comment files lawsuit
item.description: Iowa teacher sues school district after firing over Charlie Kirk Facebook post, claiming First Amendment violation in latest educator lawsuit.

item.title: Meet Walmart’s new CEO, John Furner: Once an hourly worker, he’ll helm the top company in the Fortune 500
item.description: Furner said he learned the value of hard work from his grandfather, who was a farmer.

item.title: Yes, President Trump Can Pardon The 77 People Prosecuted For 2020 Election Integrity Efforts
item.description: Media wrongly insist that the pardon clause only applies to federal charges, yet every attempt to narrow the scope of pardons has failed.

item.title: Congress Didn’t Give Trump an Unlimited License to Tariff
item.description: The best legal argument for the Trump tariffs assumes that we are currently in a declared war with every country on the planet.

item.description: His visit is billed as an official working visit because Prince Mohammed is not technically a head of state, the official said.

item.title: Rep. Eric Swalwell faces mortgage fraud probe by DOJ
item.description: Rep. Eric Swalwell has been referred to the Justice Department for a criminal probe of alleged mortgage and tax fraud.

item.title: The Spiritual Tariffs on Ballad of a Small Player
item.description: A psychodrama about the West’s diminishing identity.

item.title: 43-year-old democratic socialist who’s never held elected office unseats Seattle Mayor in another win for affordability politics
item.description: Katie Wilson is a renter herself, of a one-bedroom apartment in Capitol Hill, and says it shaped her understanding of Seattle’s affordability crisis.

item.description: Welcome to the Fox News Politics newsletter, with the latest updates on the Trump administration, Capitol Hill and more Fox News politics content.

item.title: Ken Burns’ The American Revolution Kicks Off the Quarter-Millennial Celebrations
item.description: The famed documentarian takes on the American founding, and the result is an inspiring reminder that we have much to be grateful for.

item.title: With Jocelyn Benson Set To Referee Her Own Race For Governor, Michigan GOP Asks DOJ To Monitor Election
item.description: Michigan Sec. of State Jocelyn Benson, a Democrat, will oversee her own election results when she appears on the ballot.
